<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Standard">[Sudden Blight](/Spells.aspx?ID=720)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Necromancy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=117" />
<trait label="Negative" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=118" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 226 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

<row gap="tiny">
<row>**Cast**</row>
<row><actions string="Two Actions" /></row>
<row>[somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)</row>
</row>

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 120 feet

**Area** 20-foot burst

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Saving Throw** [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude

</row>

</column>

---

You accelerate the processes of decay in the area. Each living creature in the area takes 2d10 negative damage (basic Fortitude save). A creature afflicted by a [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46) takes a –2 circumstance penalty to this save.

 You can also direct the blight to rot all Small and Tiny non-creature plants in the area, eliminating non-magical undergrowth and any resulting difficult terrain, cover, and concealment. _Sudden blight_ attempts to counteract any magical effect on the plants before withering them.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The damage increases by 1d10.
name: Sudden Blight
